column5: My fishing season is now over and it is a matter of time before I will get cabin fever. Watching a movie that I enjoy will help me through the winter. Here are some of my top picks.  For The Adults  1  Jaws -1975 2  Captains Courageous -1937 3  Man's Favorite Sport -1964 4  A River Runs Through It -1992 5  Grumpy Old Men -1993  For The Kids & Family  1  Finding Nemo -2003 2  Whale Rider -2002 3  Moby Dick -1956 4  The Little Mermaid -1989 5  The Incredible Mr. Limpet -1964
The Hunt for Red October; fishing with a nuke machine
"The old man and the sea"
Nelly, what you talking about cabin fever, month and half, ice fishing.....
The original " Old Man and the Sea",with Spencer Tracy.
Get the WFN and you have lots of action all year long or go to their website and watch for free.
I'd have to say Big Fish (2003) with Ewan McGregor. Good flick. Only a little bit of fish'n but still cool.
Grumpy Old Men.
" Gone Fishin!" with Joe Pesci and Danny Glover, always good for a laugh!
Deliverance.  For obvious reasons.
I agree with Grumpy Old Men
gone fishin is a good one,   surprised only one other mention for it.....   a river runs.... is another good one,

Well there not fishing movies however some deal with water.  1.  Master and Commander...The far side of the world  ( one of the few I purchased and didn't download )  2.  A Prefect storm  3.  The Shipping News  ( watched it 5 times so far )  4.  American Beauty  ( Kevin Spacey is one of my favourite actors )  5.  Napoleon Dynamite  ( don't ask me why )  6.  Man In The Wilderness  ( old but a classic )  7.  A Man for all Seasons  ( Thomas Moore had scruples )  8.  Driving Miss Daisy  ( See it more than 10 times )  And probably 10 or there about others.
I was going to say grumpy old men and then I thought, JAWS, absolutely!!! Du dum, du dum, du dum du dum du dum, chomp.  Pam
On Golden Pond anyone?
hahaha you sick idiot
MY Avatar from the old board       THAT'S A 20 FOOTER.......25.......THREE TONS OF EM   Where's Uncle Buck, I know his answer to this thread as well.

Put up another vote for "Old Man and the Sea". Can't beat Hemmingway. Best character in a fishing movie goes to this guy.  Gotta love when the fisherman becomes fish food. Best fishing scene is in "Waterworld" where Costner uses himself as bait, trolling behind his boat.
Gotta agree with Express168 on this one: Gone Fishing with Joe Pesci and Danny Glover.
Snag, 20 mins have passed since I first read your reply and I'm still laughing...thanks.

SNAG-you might also enjoy Ravevenous, it's about cannibalism.  http://videodetective.com/default.asp?fram...ublishedID=8404  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  GARRYV-this is the first time I have heard about this movie and it is based on a true story of Hugh Glass. I read some of it on the internet and found it very interesting. I will check it out for sure. I also found a movie called Jeremiah Johnson that you may find interesting.  http://videodetective.com/default.asp?fram...ublishedID=1778
Jaws 3 in 3d

don't worry about movies fish steelhead and then hit up the ice fishing
